sentences.english: The Japanese had captured 440 minke whales.
sentences.chinese: 日本人曾经捕获过440条小须鲸。

sentences.english: In fact, at least six species of baleen whales have been detected singing in the region.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，在这个区域至少监测到了六种须鲸的声波。

sentences.english: A dwarf minke whale swims near Australia's Great Barrier Reef .
sentences.chinese: 一头小须鲸正在澳大利亚大堡礁附近游弋。

sentences.english: Later in the evolution of whale hearing, the toothed and baleen whales parted ways.
sentences.chinese: 鲸豚听觉的演化到了后期，齿鲸与须鲸就分道扬镳了。

sentences.english: Populations of large baleen whales now store only 15 percent of the carbon they had before whaling.
sentences.chinese: 大长须鲸种群现在所储存的碳只有捕鲸前的15%。

sentences.english: Is anyway not to put the sell those poor minke whales to hotel.
sentences.chinese: 还死活不放的把那些可怜的小须鲸拿到饭店出售。

sentences.english: Large baleen whales are of special concern.
sentences.chinese: 大型鲸须鲸是最受关注的物种。

sentences.english: Fin whales are the world's second largest animal.
sentences.chinese: 长须鲸是实际上第二大的动物。

sentences.english: Blue Whale is the biggest in Minke whales.
sentences.chinese: 蓝鲸是须鲸中最大的一种。

sentences.english: We can be divided into two categories, baleen and toothed whales.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以分为两类，须鲸和齿鲸。

sentences.english: They hunt the Atlantic minke whale, which has a population of about 103, 000.
sentences.chinese: 他们所捕的大西洋小须鲸种群大约有103000头。

definition: bony fishes/Osteichthyes (taxonomic class including most fish)
